name: BudhaSubba Temple
description: Budhasubba Mandir is uniquely notable for its blend of local folklore and the ritual of animal sacrifices, highlighting the community's spiritual and cultural identity

name: Gokyo Lakes
description: A series of high-altitude lakes known for their breathtaking views and trekking routes in the Everest region.

name: Mai Pokhari
description: Mai Pokhari is a serene pond surrounded by lush forests and is a popular spot for picnics and nature walks.

name: Hile
description: Hile is a picturesque town famous for its stunning views of the Himalayas and is a popular stop for trekkers heading to the eastern regions.

name: Brahmakhal
description: Brahmakhal is a scenic area in Udayapur known for its beautiful landscapes and cultural significance, making it ideal for trekking and outdoor activities.

name: Makalu Base Camp
description: Makalu Base Camp offers stunning views of the world's fifth-highest mountain, Makalu, and is a popular trekking destination in the eastern Himalayas.

name: Pathivara Temple
description: Pathivara Temple is a revered Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Pathivara, located at an altitude of 3,794 meters (12,448 feet), offering stunning views of the surrounding mountains.

name: Kanyam
description: Kanyam is a picturesque tea garden village in eastern Nepal, renowned for its lush landscapes and serene atmosphere

name: Halesi Mahadev
description: It is cave and temple which has  venerated pilgrimage site for Hindus, Buddhists and Kirat.

name: Kankai
description: Kankai is known for the Kankai Mai Temple, a significant pilgrimage site, and its surrounding natural beauty, attracting both pilgrims and tourists.

name: Janakpurdham
description: It is is renowned as the birthplace of Sita from the Ramayana and a center of Mithila culture and art.

name: Siddhi Vinayak Temple
description: Siddhi Vinayak Temple is dedicated to Lord Ganesha and is a significant site for worship, especially during festivals.

name: Gadhimai Temple
description: Gadhimai Temple is a famous Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Gadhimai, known for its large animal sacrifice festival held every five years, attracting thousands of devotees.

name: Gosaikunda Lake
description: Gosaikunda Lake is a sacred alpine lake situated at an altitude of 4,380 meters (14,370 feet) and is an important pilgrimage site for Hindus.

name: Kakani
description: Kakani is a serene hill station near Kathmandu, known for its panoramic views of the Himalayas and strawberry farming.

name: Chitlang
description: Chitlang is a charming village in the Makwanpur District, known for its rich cultural heritage, stunning landscapes, and hiking opportunities. It's a popular destination for both local and international tourists.

name: Pashupatinath Temple
description: It is devoted to the Hindu god Shiva in his form as Pashupati, protector of animals.

name: Krishna Mandir
description: It was a cultural stronghold of the Malla kings of Kathmandu valley

name: Changu Narayan Temple
description: It is the oldest temple in Nepal dating back to the 5th century.

name: Patan Durbar Square
description: Patan Durbar Square is a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its stunning architecture, ancient temples, and rich history.

name: Nagarkot
description: Nagarkot is a popular hill station near Kathmandu, known for its stunning sunrise views over the Himalayas and trekking opportunities.

name: Panch Pokhari
description: Panch Pokhari is a sacred site consisting of five lakes, popular among pilgrims and trekkers for its stunning scenery and cultural significance.

name: Langtang Valley
description: Langtang Valley is a popular trekking destination known for its stunning landscapes, diverse wildlife, and traditional Tamang culture.

name: Phulchoki Hill
description: Phulchoki is the highest hill surrounding the Kathmandu Valley, offering beautiful hiking trails, panoramic views, and diverse flora and fauna.

name: Ghandruk
description: Ghandruk is a charming Gurung village that offers stunning views of the Annapurna range and serves as a gateway for treks in the Annapurna region.

name: Tal Barahi Temple
description: Located in Phewa Lake, this temple lake is known for its cultural significance and beautiful surroundings.

name: Begnas Lake
description: Begnas Lake is a serene freshwater lake located about 15 km east of Pokhara. It is known for its tranquil environment, picturesque surroundings, and boating opportunities.

name: Muktinath Temple
description: Muktinath is a sacred site for both Hindus and Buddhists, known for its temple and the 108 water spouts, set against a stunning mountain backdrop.

name: Bandipur
description: Bandipur is a picturesque hilltop town known for its preserved cultural heritage, traditional Newari architecture, and stunning views of the Himalayas.

name: Khaireni Waterfall
description: A hidden waterfall that is perfect for a refreshing swim and enjoying nature.

name: Dhorpatan Hunting Reserve
description: Dhorpatan is a renowned hunting reserve and trekking destination, famous for its diverse wildlife and stunning landscapes, located at an altitude of around 2,850 meters (9,350 feet).

name: Pumdikot Shiva Statue
description: Pumdikot has the second tallest statue of Shiva in Nepal. The statue itself is 51 feet tall. It sits on a white stupa that adds 57 feet in height, making the entire structure 108 feet high.

name: Tilicho Lake
description: Tilicho Lake is one of the highest lakes in the world, located at an altitude of 4,919 meters (16,138 feet) in the Nepalese Himalayas.

name: Phewa Lake
description: Phewa Lake is a stunning freshwater lake known for its scenic beauty and the reflection of the Annapurna mountain range, popular for boating and fishing.

name: Annapurna Base Camp
description: Annapurna Base Camp is a popular trekking destination located at an altitude of 4,130 meters (13,550 feet), offering breathtaking views of the Annapurna massif.

name: Chiuri Bhir
description: It is known to be as an adventerous place with beautiful view of Aadhikhola river below and has a suspension bridge to experience the thrill.

name: Mangal Momo House
description: If you are momo lover then you must go visit.

name: Karuna Driving Institute
description: A driving school that is providing driving classes from more than 6+ years, A+ driving institute in town.

name: Akaladevi Temple
description: It is a ancient temple with wide range of religious status and is considered as templ of very powerful goddess.

name: Galyang Multiple Campus
description: It is an Educational institution affiliated to TU and offers diverse range of Bachelor's levels courses in affordable prices and quality environment.

name: Pragya Kirana Pasal
description: A shop with all the household goods and things, catch it

name: Chirag Higher Secondary School
description: It is an Educational institution with highest educational recognitions and quality

name: BhuPu Sainik Secondary School
description: It is an Educational institution with quality environment.

name: Aalam Devi Mandir
description: It is a religious place located in Galyang Syangja consisting ancient ritual practice.

name: Siddha Gufa
description: It is a ancient cave consisting various ancient structures and statues.

name: Old Galyang Bazaar
description: A traditional marketplace reflecting the lifestyle and culture of Galyang.

name: Chhaya Chhetra Temple (Chhangchhangdi)
description: This is an ancient temple containing various religious aspects. This temple is very popular as lord Shiva is worshiped out there.

name: Pothana Pass
description: A beautiful pass offering panoramic views of the hills and terraced farms along the route.

name: Bhalupahad
description: Bhalu Pahad, located in Syangja district, Nepal, is a charming hill station known for its scenic beauty and serene environment. Easily accessible via the Siddhartha Highway, it's a popular spot for picnics and sightseeing.

name: Bhirkot Fort
description: An ancient fort that once served as a military stronghold, now a historical site with scenic views.

name: sorek maidan
description: It is hill providing beautiful scenario with clouds and feels like a way to heaven. Also often professional paragliders also do paraglidings from there

name: Simalchaur Viewpoint
description: A lesser-known viewpoint offering a panoramic view of the Annapurna range and surrounding landscapes.

name: Garausur Mandir
description: It is a religious place located in Galyang Syangja consisting ancient ritual practice.

name: Darsing Cave
description: A hidden cave with unique rock formations, rumored to have historical significance.

name: Resunga
description: Resunga is a prominent hill located in Gulmi, known for its panoramic views, lush forests, and the historical Resunga Temple. It is a popular destination for trekking and offers cultural experiences related to the local communities.

name: Rani Mahal
description: Historical palace for a queen made by a king.

name: Majuwa Waterfall
description: A beautiful waterfall located in a serene environment, popular among locals for relaxation and picnics.

name: Tansen
description: Tansen is a historical hill town known for its rich culture, beautiful views of the Himalayas, and traditional craftsmanship, especially in weaving and metalwork.

name: Khanchan Dham
description: A tranquil spiritual site featuring ancient shrines, meditation areas, and beautiful gardens. It is known for its peaceful environment and historical significance, attracting those seeking spiritual solace.

name: Bishwokarma Temple
description: This temple is dedicated to Bishwokarma, the deity of craftsmanship and artisans. Surrounded by lush fields and local villages, it serves as a community gathering place for festivals and rituals.

name: Puskar Pond
description: A serene pond with significant historical ties to the birthplace of Queen Mayadevi, the mother of Buddha. The area is ideal for peaceful reflection and birdwatching.

name: Gaddhi Danda
description: A hill offering panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. It's a perfect spot for hiking, picnics, and watching the sunset.

name: Lumbini Museum
description: A small yet informative museum displaying artifacts and historical items related to Buddha’s life and the history of Lumbini.

name: Shree Amar Singh Thapa Memorial Park
description: A well-maintained park dedicated to the local hero Amar Singh Thapa, featuring statues, walking paths, and gardens, making it a great place for family outings.

name: Lumbini Chhath Ghat
description: A serene riverside ghat popular among locals during the Chhath festival, offering a peaceful environment for rituals and relaxation.

name: Nandani Park
description: A public park featuring walking trails, playgrounds, and picnic areas. It’s a favorite spot for families and children to enjoy outdoor activities.

name: Kotihawa Stupa
description: A lesser-known stupa that holds cultural and historical significance. The site is peaceful and perfect for meditation and contemplation.

name: Lumbini Cultural Village
description: A cultural village showcasing traditional Nepali lifestyle, crafts, and cuisine. Visitors can interact with locals and learn about their customs.

name: Tharu Cultural Center
description: A center dedicated to preserving and promoting Tharu culture, featuring exhibitions, performances, and traditional crafts.

name: Devdaha Sacred Forest
description: A lush forest area rich in biodiversity, perfect for nature walks, birdwatching, and experiencing the tranquility of the wilderness.

name: Maijogmai Lake
description: A hidden lake surrounded by lush greenery, ideal for picnics and relaxation away from the bustling tourist areas.

address: Devdaha, near the ancient Devdaha Palace
name: Devdaha Palace Ruins
description: The remnants of an ancient palace believed to be the residence of Queen Mayadevi. The site provides insight into the historical significance of the area.

address: Near Dhaneswori River, Buddha Nagar, Rupandehi
name: Dhaneswori Temple
description: A picturesque temple situated along the Dhaneswori River, offering stunning views and a tranquil atmosphere. It’s a popular site for local festivals.

address: Siddhartha Highway, Rupandehi, near the border of Lumbini
name: Buddha Garden
description: A hidden garden featuring various species of plants, statues of Buddha, and peaceful walking paths. It offers a relaxing environment for meditation and enjoying nature.

name: Lumbini
description: Birth Place of Lord Buddha

name: Kharel Danda Hilltop
description: A quiet hilltop perfect for sunset views and peaceful solitude.

name: Rara Lake
description: Rara lake is  the largest fresh water lake in the Nepalese Himalayas

name: Kakre Bihar
description: Kakre Bihar is an ancient archaeological site featuring the ruins of a historic Buddhist monastery, attracting researchers and tourists interested in history and spirituality.

name: Shey Phoksundo Lake
description: Shey Phoksundo Lake is the deepest lake in Nepal, located at an altitude of 3,613 meters (11,821 feet) within the stunning Phoksundo National Park.

name: Deuti Bajai
description: Deuti Bajai is a popular pilgrimage site located in Surkhet, dedicated to the goddess Bajai. It is known for its serene environment and attracts many devotees, especially during festivals.

name: Badimalika Temple
description: Badimalika is a significant religious site known for the Badimalika Temple, located at an altitude of about 4,200 meters (13,780 feet), attracting numerous pilgrims and trekkers.
